body_html: Similar issues arise on my cluster where multiple versions of GCC/glibcxx co-exist. Hard-coded /usr/bin/gcc and /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6 doesn't make sense. By far, there seems to be no way to fix the GLIBCXX issues on CentOS/RHEL 6.x.
body_text: Similar issues arise on my cluster where multiple versions of GCC/glibcxx co-exist. Hard-coded /usr/bin/gcc and /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6 doesn't make sense. By far, there seems to be no way to fix the GLIBCXX issues on CentOS/RHEL 6.x.
body: Similar issues arise on my cluster where multiple versions of GCC/glibcxx co-exist. Hard-coded `/usr/bin/gcc` and `/usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6` doesn't make sense. By far, there seems to be no way to fix the `GLIBCXX` issues on CentOS/RHEL 6.x.
